abstract: Chuck D of Public Enemy once said that rap music was the CNN of the ghetto. These days, it seems, the New York Public Library is Madison Square Garden for lions of hip-hop trying to send new books to the top of the charts.
snippet: Chuck D of Public Enemy once said that rap music was the CNN of the ghetto. These days, it seems, the New York Public Library is Madison Square Garden for lions of hip-hop trying to send new books to the top of the charts.

keywords.name: unknown
keywords.value: Def Jam Recordings: The First 25 Years of the Last Great Record Label (Book)

lead_paragraph: Chuck D of Public Enemy once famously said that rap music was the CNN of the ghetto. These days, it seems, the New York Public Library is Madison Square Garden - or maybe the Hot 97 - for lions of hip-hop trying to send glossy new books to the top of the charts.

headline.main: At the Library, Vintage Hip-Hop and Meditation
